item.title: Jan Plat's aunt Natta sang the ≠gebbi-ggu
item.summary: Jan Plat's aunt Natta sang and taught the people the singing of the ≠gebbi-ggu. She could imitate (by singing) a ewe's call to its young as well as the call of a partridge, using different parts of her throat.
item.comments: 1) See also Picture of Mr Orpen's, 2) This story is found in Book V-25
item.author: Dia!kwain (David Hoesar) (V)
